chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent
Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Riddle, Barry W
defendant.address: 150 S Rose St, Lyndon Station, WI 53944

records.addlTxt:
9:03 AM Defendant Barry W Riddle in court, in custody.  Attorney Blake Duren in court for Barry W Riddle.  Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Interpreter Mavreen M. (sworn) also appears by phone for the victim in 22CF11, who is also present, M.C.  Court notes a PSI has been filed - parties have rec/rev that.  Court has rec VIS and parties have rev. that.  Victim M.C. wishes to make a statement.  Statement made from witness stand.  State makes their recommendations.  State notes there are 2 Juneau Co cases also being read-in.  State states the their recommendations and makes argument.  Atty Duren makes their recommendation and makes argument.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court reminds DE re: voting rights and felony firearms warnings.

19CF554
Ct 1:  2 years prison (1 year initial confinement and 1 year extended supervision) consecutive to any other sentences
$528.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office 
DNA sample to be provided

19CF620
Ct 1:  6 years prison (3 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision) consecutive to any other sentences but concurrent to Ct 2 and Ct 15 of this case and concurrent to 19CF621
$528.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office 
DNA sample to be provided
Ct 2:  6 years prison  (3 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision) concurrent to Ct 1 and Ct 15 of this case but consecutive to any other sentences but concurrent to 19CF621
$528.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office 
DNA sample to be provided
Ct 15:  9 months jail concurrent to counts 1 and 2 of this case and 19CF621 but consecutive to any other sentences
$453.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office 
DNA sample to be provided

19CF621
Ct 1:  6 years prison (3 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision) consecutive to any other sentences but concurrent to other counts in this case - concurrent to 19CF620
$528.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office 
DNA sample to be provided
Ct 3:   6 years prison (3 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision) consecutive to any other sentences but concurrent to other counts in this case - concurrent to 19CF620
$528.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office 
DNA sample to be provided
Ct 5:  9 months jail concurrent to other counts in this case and 19CF620 but consecutive to any other
$453.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office
DNA sample to be provided

21CF617
Ct 1:  2 years prison (1 year initial confinement and 1 year extended supervision) consecutive to all other sentences
$528.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office
DNA sample to be provided

Conditions of extended supervision in all cases:
DE is eligible for SAP but not CIP
No contact w/any victims of any of these cases
No contact w/mini-warehouse in Baraboo or any other storage units in Sauk Co
No contact w/Polynesian Resort
AODA assessment and follow through w/any recommended treatment
Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances
No possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid prescription
Report receipt of any prescriptions to the agent w/in 24 hours
No presence in any bars/taverns/liquor stores
Random UA's per agent
Seek/maintain full-time employment
Payment of restitution per stipulations to be paid to the Clerk of Courts Office at a rate of 50% from prison funds then per schedule to be determined by the agent
Credit to be determined by stipulation at a later date
Sentencing hearing on August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on July 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:16 AM Defendant Barry W Riddle in court with attorney Blake Duren.  Defendant Barry W Riddle in custody.  Emily Eklund appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and appearances.  Parties have reached agreement to plea today and set out for PSI and argued sentencing excluding restitution which is stipulated to.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver in 22CF11.  DE agrees to waive the prelim.  Court accepts waiver/finds probable cause/binds DE over.  Atty Duren acknowledges rec. information and waives reading.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  21CF617 - Court notes amended information has been filed adding counts from Juneau Co cases.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties of counts 5 and 6 only as those are the Juneau Co cases that have been added to the Sauk Co information.  State states the joint recommendations as far as the plea agreement.  Atty Duren notes they are requesting a PSI and a sentencing date be set out.  State notes the restitution is the only stipulation at this time as far as sentencing.  Atty Duren agrees and they have signed restitution stipulations.  State notes Ch 950 has been complied with.  Court questions DE on plea questionaires/agreement.  DE enters NC pleas to agreed counts.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds DE guilty.  Remaining counts are dismiss/read-in.  Court orders PSI and approves restitution stipulations as provided.  State asks that bond be revoked noting DE is on cash bond in Juneau Co on those cases and since he has now plead that he be held.  Atty Duren objects to the bond being revoked pending SEH and PSI.  Court does order the bond be revoked and DE be held pending SEH and PSI.  Counsel to reach out to JA re: SEH.  Court reminds DE re: voting rights and felony firearms warnings.  PSI to be completed by 6/22/2022.

19CF554
Ct 1:  NC
Ct 2:  Dismissed/read-in

19CF620

Ct 2:  NC
Ct 15:  NC
Cts 3-14:  Dismissed/read-in

Ct 3:  NC
Ct 5:  NC

21CF617
Ct 1:  NC

22CF11 is dismissed/read-in

***All other counts in the other 4 cases are dismissed/read-in***

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on April 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

09:38 AM Defendant Barry W Riddle in court with attorney Blake Duren.  Defendant Barry W Riddle in custody.  Rick C Spoentgen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim also appears in person and interpreter Mavreen Masere (sworn) appears by phone from SWITS.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  State requests $1,000 cash and no contact provision.  Atty Duren doesn't object.  Time limits waived for prelim.  Atty Duren notes DE has several pending cases and notes this will likely be part of a global resolution.  Court asks that Atty Duren get plea/sent date from JA.  State doesn't object.  $1,000.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/M.C.
